name: strawberry fields pouch
notes:
+[youtube tutorial][1]!

the strawberry fields pouch is a stranded colorwork pouch knit bottom-up with double folded edges that house the i-cord drawstrings. finished measurements are 6in/15.25cm (w) x 8in/20.3cm (l) but you can modify the number of cast-on stitches and number of repeats of the chart to make any size pouch you’d like!

yarn: 
i used fingering weight scrap yarn from previous projects
•	mc: 25g friends cotton 8/4 in oatmilk (#003)
      o	approx. 80m (87yds)
      o	yarn is 160m (174yds) per 50g
•	cc1: 15g hikoo cobasi in vavavavoom red (#054)
      o	approx. 60m (66yds)
      o	yarn is 201m (220yds) per 50g
•	cc2: 12g friends cotton 8/4 in sage (#114)
      o	approx. 39m (42yds)
      o	yarn is 160m (174yds) per 50g

suggested yarn: 
any fingering weight yarn in the necessary colors should work great!

needles: 3.25mm (us size 3) 100cm circular needles

notions: tapestry needle, stitch marker, scissors, safety pin

gauge: 31 sts x 38 rows = 10cm/4” in colorwork chart on 3.25mm (us size 3) needles after blocking 


  [1]: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pphk21n1yzo
